clauses.title: Property Let
clauses.body: The Landlord lets and the Tenant takes the residential property described as: [service_or_property] for the term of [term] beginning on [start_date] and ending on [end_date], unless terminated earlier in accordance with this agreement.

clauses.title: Rent and Charges
clauses.body: The Tenant shall pay rent of £[fee] per month, payable in advance on the [day] of each month. The Tenant shall also pay for all utilities, council tax, and communication services unless otherwise agreed. A security deposit of £[amount] is held against damages.

clauses.title: Tenant Responsibilities
clauses.body: The Tenant shall: use the property as a private residence only; keep the property clean and in good condition; report repairs needed promptly; not make alterations without consent; not cause nuisance to neighbours; and allow reasonable access for inspections/repairs with notice.

clauses.title: Repairs and Damage
clauses.body: The Landlord maintains the structure, exterior, and installations for water, gas, electricity. The Tenant is responsible for damage caused by negligence or misuse. The security deposit will be protected in a government-approved scheme and deductions may be made for cleaning, damages, or unpaid rent.

clauses.title: Termination
clauses.body: After the fixed term, this becomes a periodic tenancy continuable by [period] notice. During the fixed term, early termination may require payment of reletting costs. The Landlord may seek possession for non-payment, breach of terms, or at end of term with proper notice.

clauses.title: Governing Law
clauses.body: This agreement is governed by the laws of England and Wales.
